content.title: Barbershop Renovation Grant
content.beneficiary: Traditional Barbers from Other Backward Communities
content.details: The traditional barbers are one of the most backward communities in Kerala. In the transformed modern scenario, this community faces challenges in their life related to the traditionally involved occupation of them. To keep up their survival in society, it is needed to strengthen them by modernizing and renovating their work sites. The scheme envisages improving the working environment and materials of the traditional barbershop to alleviate the problems faced by traditional barbers.
benefits: Financial assistance transferred through online fund transfer system
Grant can be used for purchasing instruments, furniture, and hygiene supplies
eligibility: Belongs to State Other Backward Communities
Barbershop must be in rural areas
Annual family income does not exceed ₹1,00,000/-
Minimum of ten years of work experience
Age limit not more than 60 years
documents_required: Ownership certificate of the shop or tenant-rent agreement
Certificate from the concerned if registered under LSGDs

faqs.question: What is the 'Barbershop Renovation Grant' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme envisages improving the working environment and materials of the traditional barbershop to alleviate the problems faced by traditional barbers.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to uplift the dignity of the traditional Barber communities by modernizing their shops, to improve the standard of living of the above-serving professionals, to spread public awareness of the Government's concern and efforts to help the people who undertaking this profession & to improve the Public health by providing hygienic infrastructure.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Backward Communities Development Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The traditional barber who is belonging to the Other Backward Community of Kerala is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How much grant will be given to the eligible barber under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum grant that can be availed by a beneficiary under the scheme is ₹25,000/-.

faqs.question: For which purpose can the grant be used by the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The grant may be used to purchase instruments & furniture, Germs killers, sterilizing instruments, disposable towels and to ensure the hygiene of the existing shop.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the barbers of rural areas?
faqs.answer: Yes, the barbershop must be in rural areas.

faqs.question: What is the annual family income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual family income of the applicant from all sources does not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the minimum experience required to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should have a minimum of ten years of work experience and also currently engaged in the profession at present.

faqs.question: What is the maximum age limit of the applicant?
faqs.answer: The age limit of the applicant should not be more than 60 years.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may submit the completely filled application form along with all the relevant documents to the concerned Grama Panchayath.
